New Records: Rodrygo scored the only goal of the match at minute 30'
Key Match Events: Rodrygo scored the goal from outside the box at minute 30'
Brazil won the match 1-0 at halftime
Yellow card for Lucas Moura after a foul on Carlos Gruezo at minute 80'
Substitution for Brazil: Lucas Paquetá and Lucas Moura leave the field at minute 77'
Substitution for Ecuador: Enner Valencia and John Yeboah leave the field at minute 70'
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil and Ecuador were competing in matchday 7 of the South American Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup
Ecuador was in fifth place with 8 points and a goal difference of +2 before the match
Brazil was in sixth place with 7 points and a goal difference of +1 before the match
The match was played at the Major Antônio Couto Pereira Stadium in Curitiba, Brazil
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil's coach Dorival Júnior praised the team's resilience after the win
Ecuador's coach Sebastian Beccacece expressed frustration with the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was broadcasted live on VAVEL and available to watch online
The referee team included Facundo Tello as the main referee
Rodrygo and Kevin Rodriguez were highlighted as key players to watch
Others: Live updates and real-time analysis were provided throughout the match
